user_question: How can I capture the Milky Way with my DSLR camera, and can you generate an image of the Milky Way over a desert landscape?
final_answer: To capture the Milky Way with a DSLR, use a wide-angle lens, set the aperture to f/2.8 or lower, ISO to 3200, and shutter speed to 20 seconds. Image of the Milky Way over a desert landscape generated. The best time to photograph the Milky Way is from April to September.

steps.content: The best time to photograph the Milky Way is from April to September, when it is most visible in the night sky.
